    "following the pioneering work of bautin [ b ] , we refer to @xmath11 as the _ bautin ideal _ of @xmath0 in @xmath14 .",
    "further , @xmath15 is called the _ central set _ of @xmath0 in @xmath14 . the hilbert finiteness theorem",
    "states that @xmath11 is generated by a finite number of coefficients . _",
    "the bautin index _ of @xmath16 in @xmath14 is the minimal number @xmath17 such that @xmath18 generate @xmath11 .",
    "usually computing @xmath11 and @xmath17 is not easy .",

    "this result follows from some theorems of [ fy ] based on the fact that @xmath32 .",
    "in particular , the required conditions are satisfied if @xmath0 depends linearly on @xmath20 .",
    "the main purpose of the present paper is to extend the above result to a general situation .    in [ ry ]",
    "it was shown that one can obtain a local upper bound on the number of zeros of @xmath0 just in terms of @xmath17 .",
    "more precisely , there is some small positive @xmath33 depending on @xmath17 and @xmath11 such that each function @xmath34 has at most @xmath17 complex zeros in the disk @xmath4 . in our paper",
    "we will improve this estimate and will show that another algebraic characteristic of @xmath11 is responsible to the estimate of the number of zeros of @xmath0 .",
    "moreover , our local estimate is sharp . +",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 be a family of holomorphic functions in the unit disk @xmath1 , holomorphic in parameter @xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> we estimate the number of zeros of @xmath0 in a smaller disk via some characteristic of the ideal generated by taylor coefficients of @xmath0 . our estimate is locally sharp and improve the previous estimate obtained in [ ry ] .    </S>",
    "<S> -10 mm    = msbm10 scaled 1 = msbm7 scaled 1 = msbm5 scaled 1 = = = p [ section ] [ th]lemma [ th]corollary [ th]definition [ th]proposition [ th]remark [ th]example </S>"
  ]
}
